Today, [[Dan Friesen|Dan]] and [[Jordan Holmes|Jordan]] celebrate their landmark 703rd episode by finally covering perhaps the most important day in [[Alex Jones]]' career, September 11, 2001.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/7/17/episode-703-911-part-1 Episode #703: 9/11, Part 1]</ref>:

*Alex's immediate response to the 9/11 attacks
*Loose Change [http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/trutherism/2011/09/the_rise_of_truth.html had to be edited repeatedly]
*Alex [https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1995-03-08-mn-40189-story.html has details wrong] about Emad Salem's involvement in the 1993 WTC bombing
*In 1998, the military [https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-2000-mar-31-mn-14533-story.html mandated the anthrax vaccine], and in 2000 Major Sonnie Bates was discharged for refusing to take the vaccine. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/2001/05/03/lawsuit-on-anthrax-vaccinations-targets-fda-role/4829b3a5-48e4-4833-911e-e7ea5a072595/ Sonnie would go on to sue the FDA]
*In June 2001, [https://www.centerforhealthsecurity.org/our-work/exercises/2001_dark-winter/about.html Johns Hopkins held a tabletop exercise] that involved a smallpox outbreak
*The [https://www.wilsoncenter.org/article/the-lessons-post-911-border-management borders were not closed] in response to 9/11
*[https://brownfieldagnews.com/news/rain-comes-at-optimal-time-for-illinois-farmer/ Illinois farmer is thrilled for rain]
